title: Currículum Vitae
text: Economista con experiencia en inferencia causal, finanzas públicas y evaluación de políticas. Tengo experiencia liderando proyectos analíticos en el sector público y en la academia, con énfasis en la incorporación de herramientas estadísticas rigurosas en el diseño y evaluación de programas. Me interesan los mercados laborales, la protección social y el uso de datos para generar impacto público.

title: Currículum Vitae
text:
Experiencia Profesional
Subjefe de División, Política Fiscal
Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS) — 2023–Presente
- Planeación analítica y evaluación de políticas en materia de incorporación al mercado laboral y contribuciones a la seguridad social, utilizando datos administrativos y métodos cuasi-experimentales. - Dirijo investigaciones sobre oportunidades de recaudación utilizando métodos econométricos y aprendizaje de máquina (ML).
- Evalúo escenarios hipotéticos de reformas para estimar sus efectos sobre salarios, empleo y recaudación institucional. - Coordino y colaboro con mi equipo para (i) mejorar la vinculación de registros administrativos con encuestas nacionales, (ii) automatizar flujos de trabajo de reportes, (iii) fortalecer el rigor científico y la claridad metodológica de los distintos productos de la Coordinación, integrando fundamentos empíricos sólidos.
Asistente de Investigación, ITAM – Centro de Investigación Económica (CIE)
Proyecto J-PAL “Improving Labor Courts”, 2022–2023
- Apoyé a Enrique Seira y Joyce Sadka en trabajo de campo y análisis de datos sobre la eficiencia judicial en tribunales laborales.
- Desarrollé proyectos de investigación independientes, incluyendo un análisis de heterogeneidad de tratamiento que terminó siendo mi tesis de licenciatura. - Gestioné los flujos de datos diarios y la implementación de evaluaciones experimentales en sitio para guiar el diseño de políticas públicas.

title: Esteban Degetau
text:
About Me
I am an Economist at the Mexican Social Security Institute (IMSS). I am a candidate to receive a Master’s in Applied Economics from ITAM. My work draws on tools from labor economics and applied econometrics to study formal labor market transitions and the effects of social protection policies. I plan to begin doctoral studies in 2026.

title: Performance in the economics profession
text:
What does it mean to be an economist? Is the question I’ve asked myself since I began my training as one, back in 2016. As any other question of being, a glance through the lense of performative arts may help me understand who economists think they are and why I one to become one. After all, every sense of self in the scene of life is perhaps no more than mere performance.

The dance of social sciences
If you as I, have but a vague idea of what a performance is

title: Curriculum Vitae
text: Economist with expertise in causal inference, public finance, and policy evaluation. Experience leading analytical teams in government and academia, with a focus on incorporating rigorous statistical tools into program design and evaluation. Interested in labor markets, social protection, and the use of data for public impact.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Public Service
Subjefe de División, Política Fiscal – Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS), 2023 - Present

Lead analytical planning and policy evaluation in the areas of labor market enrollment and social security collection, using administrative data and quasi-experimental methods.
Direct research on collection opportunities and compliance strategies using econometric modeling and machine learning techniques.
Evaluate the projected impact of hypothetical policy reforms, such as eligibility rule changes, on employment, wages, and institutional revenues.
Manage and mentor a team of analysts, advancing multiple projects to (i) improve record linkage with national surveys, (ii) automate reporting workflows, (iii) enhance the rigor and clarity of policy-facing deliverables, and (iv) integrate stronger empirical foundations into ongoing evaluations.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Research Experience
Research Assistant, ITAM – Center for Economic Research (CIE), 2022 - 2023
J-PAL Project

Supported Enrique Seira and Joyce Sadka in field implementation and data analysis for randomized and quasi-experimental evaluations of labor court reforms.
Developed independent research, including a heterogeneous treatment effects analysis, which became the basis for my undergraduate thesis.
Managed daily data workflows and delivered rapid-turnaround analyses to guide field operations and policy design.

title: Curriculum Vitae
section: Public Service — Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS)
text:
Public Service — Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social (IMSS)
Sub‑Division Chief, Fiscal Policy | 2023 – Present

Spearheaded an R + targets pipeline replacing fragmented Excel workflows, reducing run‑time by 90% (40 h → 4 h) for national & 40 state‑level revenue and employment forecasts.
Processed 100 m+ administrative records each cycle via Spark/SAS, and integrated probabilistic prediction intervals achieving 93 % empirical coverage while cutting MAPE by 20 %.
Delivered daily automated slide deck tracking end‑month revenue/employment and briefed department heads.
Directed a team of analysts to improve record linkage with national surveys, automate reporting, and embed causal‑inference rigor into policy memos.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Applied Microeconomics Research

Center for Economic Research (CIE), ITAM | Research Assistant | 2022 – 2023

Supported Enrique Seira & Joyce Sadka on randomized and quasi‑experimental evaluations of labor‑court reforms; cleaned complex microdata and built daily reports for field teams.
Produced and presented interim findings at weekly co-author meetings.



Working Paper

“The Labor Market Outcomes of (Quasi) Unemployment Insurance: Evidence from Mexico’s Retiro Parcial por Desempleo”

Exploits a sharp RDD at the 24‑month contributions eligibility threshold.
Implements Generalized Random Forests to uncover heterogeneous effects across gender, age, income, and COVID‑19 exposure.
Draft, replication code, and 5‑slide summary deck available at: https://www.estebandegetau.com.
